lines.text: But an unusual mistake was made in this race for statehood. A strip of land was completely overlooked... forgotten. It was left without law or sheriff. This strip had no legal basis for government of any kind. And in the closing decade of the Nineteenth Century, it became a hideout for the outlaws who infested the west. No United States Marshal dared venture there. It was called Badman's Territory.
Well, Doc?
I'm afraid he's made his last mistake.
You'll find the people in Quinto a pretty decent lot on the whole.
Tha doesn't square with what I've seen so far.
Oh, it ain't that bad. Men that put away their guns can't argue with the men that still carry them.
Where are you headed for next, Bob?
Two banks.
Double-header, huh?
You know, I could kill you for what you just done.
Yeah, you've killed a lot for a lot less.

[to Mark]
Daggone it, Sheriff, you should have been an outlaw!
I'd advise you to remove that star.
Well, thanks, but I think I can take care of myself.
The life expectancy of a sheriff can be very short in Quinto.
Johnny, if you were an outlaw camped down there on the creek and saw a posse coming up behind you, what would you do.
I'd head up this cut to open country where a man could use a fresh horse.
Right! Now, as a deputy sheriff who's figured out the outlaw's next move.
I'd sneak up behind those trees.
Right!
And pump lead into 'em as they come up.
Wrong! A good officer don't kill except in self-defense. The saw says every man has a right to a fair trial.
Outlaws? Train robbers?
And even murderers. No man's guilty until he's convicted. So try to take your man alive.
But what if he shows fight?
That's different! Shoot and don't miss!
I, uh, see that you've been made the favorite.
Oh, it's not me. It's my horse Beauty, He's everybody's favorite.
Of course, good luck.
Wanna make a little side bet with me, Sheriff?
What f'rinstance?
Oh, money, or marbles... or moonlight.

[Turning his head]
Suppose we just make it a dollar and a half.
[Tips his hat and leaves]
I'm trying to bring some order because I want schools, ranches, churches, hospitals, a courthouse, and a flag. Is there anything wrong with that?
Nothing except the way you're goin' about it, You may start a local revolution. You can't clean up Quinto with printer's ink, and you can't do it alone.

[as Jesse is saddlig up]
Well, I hope we meet again.

[Smiling]
I don't. So long, Rowley.
So long.

[after Johnny Rowley has jumped out of tree to knock him off his horse]
Why you young whippersnapper! Where'd you drop from? A balloon?

[Referring to the plunging neckline on her dress]
Meg, you don't think it's cut too low, do you?

[Sarcastically]
It'll never choke you to death.
